summary: Fix for when your revert form from Werewolf state does not recognize your new racechange after gaining the beast blood. Efficient cure for the Werewolf exiting transformation calling back a variable that was outdated because it was the your pc\\\'s race was stored prior to having beast form.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/33563-3-1365283267.png[/img][/center]

[I][COLOR=#92D050]As of the current time of writing[/COLOR][/I] this mod utilizes [B][COLOR=#C00000]flexcreator\'s[/COLOR][/B] [U][COLOR=#C00000]Papyrus Data Transfer tool[/COLOR][/U] available here:
[COLOR=yellow][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/31675]How to REMOVE ALL embedded scripts from your savegame[/url][/COLOR]

This utility is meant to be used to [COLOR=#D8D8D8][SIZE=3]fix/reset[/SIZE][/COLOR] the race variable that the companions
quest and werewolf change functions calls when transforming back to human form
when you have changed your race \"[B][COLOR=#FFFFFF][SIZE=2]AFTER[/SIZE][/COLOR][/B]\" having the beast blood/lycanthropy/been affected
by Aela either through console commands ie. \"[I][COLOR=#92CDDC]showracemenu[/COLOR][/I]\", \"[I][COLOR=#B7DDE8]player.setrace xxxxx[/COLOR][/I]\" or 
other methods.

The issue you would have if you had done this is the player\'s original race is stored in a variable
which is baked into your save game only \"[B][COLOR=#B2A2C7]once/permanently[/COLOR][/B]\" - which is the state before you are a werewolf
then after this \"[B][COLOR=#B2A2C7]original race[/COLOR][/B]\" variable is stored once, it is always called for when reverting back to human form
from a werewolf.

[B][SIZE=3]Long story short:[/SIZE][/B] [COLOR=#C4BD97]This resets the original race variable so when you\'ve changed your race after you\'ve become 
a werewolf and load the \"new save file\" generated by this utility your current race on save game load is re-stored
and will be used to be called for again once you revert to human form, also useful if you\'re player character
is a hybrid = werewolf/vampire and you were originally a non-vampiric race then turned into one and as a hybrid
you\'re werewolf state reverts you back to that \"non-vampiric\" race.
[/COLOR]



[center]
[img]http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/33563-4-1365283267.png[/img][/center]

[SIZE=3][B]What are the advantages of resetting the variable of the original pc\'s race?:[/B][/SIZE]

1.) It is the only \"[B]true[/B]\" and also efficient way of fixing and [b]curing[/b] the problem/issue, and is [B]less of a workaround[/B].
2.) As compared to other suitable fixes that bypass this issue by changing/modifying the script \"[I][COLOR=#B2A2C7]PlayerWerewolfChangeScript[/COLOR][/I]\", 
this does not and only affects one variable in your savegame directly.
3.) Leaving the \"[I][COLOR=#B2A2C7]PlayerWerewolfChangeScript[/COLOR][/I]\" intact insures [B]maximum compatibility[/B] for other mods that change utilize that script function as well.
4.) [I][COLOR=#92D050]As of the current time of writing[/COLOR][/I] takes less then a few seconds or minutes, 9-12 click process/es.
5.) [I][COLOR=#92D050]As of the current time of writing[/COLOR][/I] this doesn\'t mess with anything else within your save, except for one variable.
[SIZE=3]
[B]What are the disadvantages?:[/B][/SIZE]

1.) You have to rerun/redo this process if you change your pc\'s race again whilst the beast blood flows in you.



[center]
[img]http://static.skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/images/33563-1-1367607153.png[/img]
